TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause extends System.IdentityModel.Tokens.BinaryKeyIdentifierClause

Docs.summary: Represents a key identifier clause that identifies an encrypted key.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, the EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause does not need to be used, other than when a custom security token service is created. When a security token service returns a security token, the issued security token contains references to attached and unattached security tokens. Attached references refer to security tokens that are contained within the security header of a SOAP message and unattached references are security tokens that are not included within the security header of a SOAP message. These references typically affirm the authenticity of the issued security token. Use the EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause class to reference an encrypted key. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.GetEncryptedKey%2A> method returns the encrypted key.
[!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] accepts wrapped keys that are well formed with respect to the wire format. The key wrap algorithm specified on the wire is accepted and used. It is not verified to be compatible with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite> specified by the endpoint.

MemberSignature.Value: public EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause (byte[] encryptedKey, string encryptionMethod);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] encryptedKey, string encryptionMethod) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains a key that is encrypted. Sets the value that is returned from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.GetEncryptedKey%2A> method.
The cryptographic algorithm that is used to encrypt the key. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.EncryptionMethod%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified key that is encrypted and the cryptographic algorithm used to encrypt the key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the static constant strings in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> to specify the cryptographic algorithm for the `encryptionMethod` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause (byte[] encryptedKey, string encryptionMethod, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier encryptingKeyIdentifier);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] encryptedKey, string encryptionMethod, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier encryptingKeyIdentifier) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains a key that is encrypted. Sets the value that is returned from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.GetEncryptedKey%2A> method.
The cryptographic algorithm that is used to encrypt the key. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.EncryptionMethod%2A> property.

A that represents the key identifier for the encrypting key that is specified in the `encryptedKey` parameter. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.EncryptingKeyIdentifier%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified key that is encrypted, the cryptographic algorithm used to encrypt the key, and a key identifier for the encrypting key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the static constant strings in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> to specify the cryptographic algorithm for the `encryptionMethod` parameter.

A that represents the key identifier for the encrypting key specified in the `encryptedKey` parameter. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.EncryptingKeyIdentifier%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause (byte[] encryptedKey, string encryptionMethod, System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier encryptingKeyIdentifier, string carriedKeyName, byte[] derivationNonce, int derivationLength);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] encryptedKey, string encryptionMethod, class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier encryptingKeyIdentifier, string carriedKeyName, unsigned int8[] derivationNonce, int32 derivationLength) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains a key that is encrypted. Sets the value that is returned from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.GetEncryptedKey%2A> method.
The cryptographic algorithm that is used to encrypt the key. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.EncryptionMethod%2A> property.

A that represents the key identifier for the key specified in the `encryptedKey` parameter. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.EncryptingKeyIdentifier%2A> property.

A user-readable name that is associated with the key specified in the `encryptedKey` parameter. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.EncryptedKeyIdentifierClause.CarriedKeyName%2A> property.

An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains the nonce that was used to create a derived key. Sets the value that is returned by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.GetDerivationNonce%2A> method.
The size of the derived key. Sets the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.DerivationLength%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified key that is encrypted, the cryptographic algorithm used to encrypt the key, a key identifier for the key and a user-readable name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the `derivationNonce` and `derivationLength` parameters are specified the implied derived key is used instead of the direct security key of the token.
Use the static constant strings in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> to specify the cryptographic algorithm for the `encryptionMethod` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public string CarriedKeyName { get; }
.property instance string CarriedKeyName

Docs.summary: Gets a user-readable name that is associated with the encrypted key.
Docs.value: A user-readable name that is associated with the encrypted key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the CarriedKeyName property is serialized into XML, it is placed in the <`CarriedKeyName`> element. For encrypted keys, the <`CarriedKeyName`> element is an optional element that associates a user-readable name with a key value. This name can then be used to reference the key using the <`KeyName`> element within the <`KeyInfo`> element. The same <`CarriedKeyName`> element value, unlike an ID value, can occur multiple times within a single document. The value of the key must be the same in all <`EncryptedKey`> elements identified with the same <`CarriedKeyName`> name within an XML document.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier EncryptingKeyIdentifier { get; }
.property instance class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier EncryptingKeyIdentifier

Docs.summary: Gets a key identifier for the encrypting key.
Docs.value: A that represents the key identifier for the encrypting key.

MemberSignature.Value: public string EncryptionMethod { get; }
.property instance string EncryptionMethod

Docs.summary: Gets the cryptographic algorithm that is used to encrypt the key.
Docs.value: The cryptographic algorithm that is used to encrypt the key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, the value of the EncryptionMethod property is one of the static constant strings in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityAlgorithms> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public byte[] GetEncryptedKey ();
.method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] GetEncryptedKey() cil managed

Docs.returns: An array of <xref:System.Byte> that contains the encrypted key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The array that is returned by the GetEncryptedKey method is a clone of the encrypted key.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string that represents the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ToString method returns a string that contains the encrypted key and the cryptographic algorithm that is used to encrypt the key.
